0.advice: Apple scab is a fungal disease. Recommended treatment includes applying fungicides like myclobutanil or captan. Prune infected branches and ensure good air circulation.

1.name: Apple___Black_rot
1.advice: Black rot is a fungal disease. Remove and destroy infected fruit and cankers. Apply appropriate fungicides during the growing season.

2.name: Apple___Cedar_apple_rust
2.advice: This is a fungal disease requiring two hosts. Remove nearby cedar trees if possible. Apply fungicides from the pink-bud stage through second cover.

4.name: Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot_Gray_leaf_spot
4.advice: This fungal disease thrives in humid conditions. Use resistant hybrids, practice crop rotation, and apply fungicides when lesions first appear.

5.name: Corn_(maize)___healthy
5.advice: The plant appears healthy. Ensure adequate nitrogen levels and monitor for common pests like corn borers.

6.name: Tomato___Bacterial_spot
6.advice: Bacterial spot is difficult to control. Use disease-free seeds, rotate crops, and apply copper-based bactericides as a preventive measure.

7.name: Tomato___Late_blight
7.advice: Late blight is a very destructive fungal disease. Ensure good air circulation, avoid overhead watering, and apply fungicides like chlorothalonil or mancozeb proactively.

8.name: Tomato___healthy
8.advice: The plant looks healthy. Maintain consistent watering and support the plant with stakes or cages to keep fruit off the ground.
